Class Encrypter

java.lang.Object
Encrypter
public class Encrypter
extends java.lang.Object
The encrypter creates a known alphabet of size 26 containing the letters A through Z. Use the encryptLetter to encrypt a single char or a whole message through the encryptMessage method.
Author:
Wil Simpson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private static char[] alphabet
    List of all capital letters from A to Z in order.

  • Constructor Summary

    Encrypter()

    Encrypts the given message by shifting each letter by the given shift size.
    private char indexToLetter​(int index)
    Expects an index inclusively between 0 and 25 and converts that into a letter given the alphabet array.

  • Field Details

    • alphabet

      private static final char[] alphabet
      List of all capital letters from A to Z in order.

  • Constructor Details

    • Encrypter

      public Encrypter()

  • Method Details

    • encryptLetter

      public char encryptLetter​(char c, int shiftSize)
      Shifts the given char by the given shift size. Only encrypts letter if it's apart of the alphabet.
      Parameters:
      c - Current char to shift
      shiftSize - amount to shift char by
      Returns:
      new shifted char value

    • encryptMessage

      public java.lang.String encryptMessage​(java.lang.String message, int shiftSize)
      Encrypts the given message by shifting each letter by the given shift size. If the number is larger than the alphabet size the shiftSize will wrap back to 0. This encryption keeps the original spacings. All letters will be converted to their uppercase equivalent if they are not already in uppercase.
      Parameters:
      message - message to encrypt
      shiftSize - amount to shift each character
      Returns:
      encrypted message

    • shouldEncryptChar

      private boolean shouldEncryptChar​(char c)
      Checks if the given char is in the alphabet.
      Parameters:
      c - char to check
      Returns:
      whether the char is in the alphabet

    • letterToIndex

      private int letterToIndex​(char letter)
      Expects a char letter from A-Z and converts it to an index in the alphabet array. If an invalid char is given an index of -1 will be returned.
      Parameters:
      letter - letter to search for in the array
      Returns:
      index of the letter in the array

    • indexToLetter

      private char indexToLetter​(int index)
      Expects an index inclusively between 0 and 25 and converts that into a letter given the alphabet array. If an invalid index is given a value of 0 is returned.
      Parameters:
      index - index of letter in array
      Returns:
      letter in array at the given index
